p: At the level of EEJs, we detected 177 differentially used EEJs (diffEEJs) upon RUNX1/RUNX1T1 knockdown that were distributed over 150 genes (Fig. 2a–c; Supplementary Fig. 2a; Supplementary Data 7). These diffEEJs belonged to the main modes of alternative splicing (Fig. 2d) and associated with all functional types of exons (Fig. 2e). In contrast to genes with condition-specific retained introns, only 55 of 378 genes with diffUEs or diffEEJs showed changes in total transcript levels upon RUNX1/RUNX1T1 knockdown (Supplementary Fig. 2b, c).
